Job.Title: Catering Assistants
Job.Description: We are currently seeking the services of experienced Catering Assistants on a Part time basis to be based at our site in Cleveland, QLD.
Job.AdDetails:
We are currently seeking the services of experienced Catering Assistants on a Part time basis to be based at our site in Cleveland, QLD. We have several Part time positions available ranging between 20-30 hours per week over 7 days.

Responsibilities include:
• Food preparation
• Assisting in dinning room set up
• Taking of orders and serving of food and beverages
• Maintaining a clean and hygienic work environment
• Cash Register operation
• Excellent customer service skills to maintain a friendly and vibrant atmosphere

Key Attributes:
• Strong customer service philosophy
• Kitchen and food preparation experience
• Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate with a range of people from all corners of the globe
• Aged Care Facility Experience or similar
• Good understanding of HACCP and food safety practices

Benefits of the position:
• Uniform Provided
• On the job training and further training opportunities
• Very friendly team

About the Company:
Cater Care Australia specialises in providing catering services to sectors such as:
• Retail – Coffee Shops
• Health & Juice Bars
• Business and Industry – Industrial Canteens
• Healthcare – Nursing Homes, Retirement Villages
• Education – Private Schools, Universities and TAFE Colleges

Our core values of Care, Pride and Community are values that our people own and believe in and demonstrate throughout all aspects of our business on a daily basis.

If you feel you are the right candidate to join our  friendly team, please forward your resume to brisbane@catercareaustralia.com.au

StandOut.Bullet2: On the job training and further training opportunities

Job.Title: Expressions of Interest: Various Roles
Job.Description: Cater Care Services specialises in providing facility support services to the Mining, Construction, Off-Shore and Defence Industries across Australia.
Job.AdDetails:
Cater Care Services specialises in providing facility support services to the Mining, Construction, Off-Shore and Defence Industries through Australia and Overseas. We are currently seeking Expressions of Interest for the following positions for a new site in Queensland:
 
  • Site Managers
  • Chefs
  • Utilities
 
The successful applicant will have the following skills or experience:
 
  • A passion for excellent customer skills
  • Motivated and accountable
  • At least 2 years relevant industry experience
  • Demonstrated experience in Safety and HACCP
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Trade qualifications
 
For all roles, you will be required to adhere to all standards as set by the Company, and you will have strong work ethics combined with time management skills and be prepared to assist all other employee in maintaining schedules and service commitments when required.
 
Experience with a similar role in a camp environment will be highly regarded.
 
These are fly in/fly out roles on a 28 day on 9 day off roster.
 
  • Current references required at the interview
  • A medical will be required
 
To apply for this position please send an Application Letter together with a resume to nia.lloyd@catercareservices.com.au

Job.Title: Utility/Assistant Manager
Job.Description: We are currently seeking applications for the position of Chef/Assistant Managers to work near Port Hedland in a remote camp setting.
Job.AdDetails:
In this role you will be responsible for ensuring effective operation of the camp for 1 week and then in a utility capacity for the other week.
 
You will be required to adhere to all standards as set by the company and you will have strong work ethics combined with time management skills and be prepared to assist all other employees in maintaining schedules and service committments when required.
 
Key attributes:
 
  • Assistant Management (on site)
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision
  • Expereince in stock control management and ordering
  • Personnel managment
  • Utility experience including kitchen and housekeeping operations
Current references will be required at the interview and pre-employment medical will also be undertaken.

Job.Description: Cater Care Services have a number of exciting new opportunities for experienced Chefs.
Job.AdDetails:
As our newly valued Chef, you will be responsible for ensuring effective operation of the food preparation, production and service requirements of the site.

We strongly encourage applicants with the following qualities to apply:

• Excellence in customer service
• Flexibility to plan residents’ catering requirements in advance
• Motivated and accountable
• Trade qualifications
• 3 years relevant industry experience
• Demonstrated experience in Safety and HACCP

You would be expected to adhere to all standards as set by the Company - in return you’ll have the opportunity to utilize your strong work ethics and time management skills. Working as part of a dynamic team your expertise and assistance will be requested for maintaining schedules and service commitments.

Experience in a similar role within a camp environment would be highly regarded.

This is a Fly In/Fly Out role on a 2 week on 1 week off roster. In addition to flights from Brisbane airport, we also offer accommodation and meals on site, 4 weeks annual leave and the opportunity for continuous growth and development.

Our core values of Care, Pride and Community are values that our people own and believe in and demonstrate throughout all aspects of our business on a daily basis.

Job.Description: Catercare are currently seeking the services of an experienced Cleaner/Kitchen Hand to be part of our site team based in Hayes Creek, Northern Territory.

  • Cleaning duties to ensure cleanliness of the site in accordance with site requirements and Company standards

The successful applicant will have the following skills or experience:

  • Exceptional customer service skills
  • Enthusiastic, motivated and reliable
  • Eye for detail
  • Knowledge of the correct use of chemicals
  • Ability to understand and comply with Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS)
  • Knowledge of the safe and correct operation of cleaning equipment
  • Food handling knowledge and skills
  • Food Handler’s Certificate or be willing to obtain one

You will be a team player with a “can do” attitude who ideally will have experience with a similar role in a remote camp environment.

  • Current references required at the interview
  • A medical will be required

This is a Drive In/Drive Out role on a 2 week on 1 week off roster. We also offer accommodation and meals on site, 4 weeks annual leave and the opportunity for continuous growth and development.

Our core values of Care, Pride and Community are values that our people own and believe in and demonstrate throughout all aspects of our business on a daily basis.

Job.Title: Safety, Health & Environment Officer
Job.Description: Cater Care are currently seeking the services of an experienced Safety, Health & Environment Officer to be part of our site team initially based near Roma, Queensland.
Job.AdDetails:
Primary Purpose:

To manage and provide support in the areas of safety, health and environment for your designated region of responsibility.

  • Establish a strong link with the CCS our Client’s OHS & Environment Management teams to ensure full compliance with CCS & Client SHE policies, systems and procedures.
  • Provide accurate and strategic KPI reporting and analysis for the Client and Cater Care business to ensure we are well informed and are able to track the company’s progress
  • Participate in the review process & provide technical support and advice for all SHE strategies as requested
  • Ensure all risk control strategies from the ‘Safe Work Procedures’ and, ‘Task Based Risk Assessments’ are reviewed and implemented on all sites.
  • Provide technical support and advice on legislative and Company requirements
  • Undertake continuous improvement activities, auditing and coaching at sites
  • Ensure all accreditation activities are achieved within budget and time frame
  • Maintain database records and generate accurate reporting data
  • Maintain established computerised SHE record management system, including registers and databases.
  • Follow standard procedures using existing models / fields of information
  • Work with Sites to ensure compliance to SHE compliance requirements
  • Liaison with your Manager to whom you will advise of all problems

The duties listed above are your key tasks, however, there will be other tasks and changes that are inevitable and not listed due to the service nature of our business and your co-operation is expected at all times.

Job Role – Essential/Desirable Criteria:

  • Computer program experience: Excel – Word - Outlook
  • HACCP working knowledge
  • Cert IV Safety
  • Cert IV Training & Assessment
  • OH&S working knowledge & Certification
  • Environmental working knowledge
  • Database experience – Record keeping
  • Demonstrated experience with key components of the role
  • Previous experience working within a Contract catering SHE environment (desirable)

Behavioural Competencies:

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Flexibility – ability to adapt to busy/changing conditions
  • Teamwork
  • Strong customer service focus
  • Accountability
  • Facilitation and presentation skills

 Duties

  1. ROI (Register Of Incidents) Review Corrective Actions
  2. Hazard Register – Enter details from off the Hazard/Near Miss Reports
    Review Corrective Actions
  3. Monthly Audit Compliance
    Enter received reports into the ‘Monthly Audit Compliance Register’
    Liaise with Site Managers to ensure all requirements are met
  4. Enter ‘Site Services & Waste Management Form’ data into Site Registers
  5. Review & produce SHE Documents as requested
  6. Complete all Client SHE documentation requirements, using their reporting procedures.

Site Task Duties

  1. Complete the ‘Site Inspection and Audit Report Summary’
  2. Close out as many corrective actions from the audit while on site
  3. Deliver a toolbox to all staff – as per the toolbox calendar and items as relevant to the site
  4. Complete and sign off on the competency based training units
  5. Attend a Client OHS meeting each visit
  6. Ensure the training register is updated
  7. Ensure Cater Care Safety Notice boards are correct and up to date.
  8. Ensure all vehicle logs are correct and up to date.

This is a Fly In Fly Out role on a 28 days on 9 days off roster. We also offer accommodation and meals on site, 4 weeks annual leave and the opportunity for continuous growth and development.

At Cater Care Services, we specialises in providing facility support services to the Mining, Construction, Off-Shore and Defence Industries through Australia and Overseas. Our core values of Care, Pride and Community are values that our people own and believe in and demonstrate throughout all aspects of our business on a daily basis.

To apply for this position ple

Benefits of the position:

• Uniform supplied
• On the job training and further training opportunities
• Fast growing company

About the Company:

Cater Care Australia specialises in providing catering services to sectors such as:
• Retail – Coffee Shops
• Health & Juice Bars
• Business and Industry – Industrial Canteens
• Healthcare – Nursing Homes, Retirement Villages
• Education – Private Schools, Universities and TAFE Colleges

Our core values of Care, Pride and Community are values that our people own and believe in and demonstrate throughout all aspects of our business on a daily basis. We value the importance of developing a career with Cater Care and not “just a job”.

Applicants will be required to undertake a police check upon commencement of employment.

If you feel you are the right candidate to join our team, please forward your resume to bryce@catercareaustralia.com.au

Job.Title: Cook/Catering Assistant
Job.Description: We are currently seeking the services of an experienced Cook/Catering Assistant on a Full time basis to assist in the delivery and preparation of meals for lunch and dinner at Snow Hydro Bistro based in Cabramurra.
Job.AdDetails:
We are currently seeking the services of an experienced Cook/Catering Assistant on a Full time basis to assist in the delivery and preparation of meals for lunch and dinner at Snow Hydro Bistro based in Cabramurra.

Responsibilities include:

• Basic  food preparation
• Short order cooking
• Food safety monitoring
• Maintaining a clean and hygienic work environment
• Company Compliance and  Workplace Health & Safety
• Ability to work in a remote/isolated area
• Excellent customer service skills to maintain a friendly and vibrant atmosphere

Key Attributes:

• Strong customer service philosophy and cash handling experience
• Kitchen and food preparation experience
• Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate with a range of people
• Good understanding of HACCP, OH&S and food safety practices
• Ability to work in a remote/isolated area

Benefits of the position:

• Subsidised accommodation provided
• On the job training and further training opportunities
• Uniform provided

About the Company:

Cater Care Australia specialises in providing catering services to sectors such as:
• Retail – Coffee Shops
• Health & Juice Bars
• Business and Industry – Industrial Canteens
• Healthcare – Nursing Homes, Retirement Villages
• Education – Private Schools, Universities and TAFE Colleges

Our core values of Care, Pride and Community are values that our people own and believe in and demonstrate throughout all aspects of our business on a daily basis.

If you feel you are the right candidate to join our friendly team, please forward your resume to bryce@catercareaustralia.com.au
